verbose_text: EHEC and the mouse A/E pathogen Citrobacter rodentium grown without DMEM priming (i.e., bacteria poorly expressing the virulence regulon) stimulate inflammasomes similarly to non pathogenic E. coli K12, resulting in non canonical NLRP3 activation in mouse macrophages at 10-18 h post-infection.
evidence: A/E pathogen Citrobacter rodentium grown without DMEM priming (i.e., bacteria poorly expressing the virulence regulon) stimulate inflammasomes similarly to non-pathogenic E. coli K12, resulting in non-canonical NLRP3
